meanings.definition: To participate in a workshop where a group of people discuss and improve a piece of writing or other creative work.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I workshopped my story with my classmates.
meanings.sent2: She workshopped her painting with the art club.
meanings.sent3: The penguins workshopped their igloo-building skills.
meanings.sent4: The team workshopped their strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent5: The students workshopped their science project to make it better.

meanings.definition: To subject (a piece of writing or other creative work) to a workshop for discussion and improvement.
meanings.sent1: The author workshopped her novel to get feedback.
meanings.sent2: He workshopped his screenplay to make it more engaging.
meanings.sent3: The robots workshopped their dance routine for the talent show.
meanings.sent4: The chef workshopped his new recipe until it was perfect.
meanings.sent5: The band workshopped their song until it sounded just right.
